Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw two different habitats, such as a land habitat (like a playground or garden) and a water habitat (like a pond or stream).
The student can draw at least two types of living things found in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, or animals like lizards or fish.
The student can show differences in the types of plants and animals found in each habitat, providing evidence of biodiversity.
The student can illustrate patterns by drawing examples of similar types of organisms (e.g., plants or animals) in both habitats, showing comparisons.
The student can organize and label their drawings clearly to communicate the diversity and patterns observed in the habitats.
